alert.note: Alert for Alexander; Jackson; Johnson; Massac; Pulaski; Union; Williamson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 1:08AM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Union, northern Pulaski, northwestern Massac, Johnson, southern Williamson, southeastern Jackson and north central Alexander Counties through 145 AM CST... At 107 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cobden to near Jonesboro to 6 miles west of Tamms. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds 30 to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Jonesboro and Cobden around 110 AM CST. Anna and Dongola around 115 AM CST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Goreville, Vienna, Karnak, Lake Of Egypt Area and Creal Springs. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Illinois between Mile Markers 1 and 19. Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 16 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Alexander; Jackson; Johnson; Massac; Pulaski; Union; Williamson
